intro: Cominsia minor, commonly known as the small cominsia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
